website_summaries.verdict: Herbal capsules that can be given to cats ahead of travel to make them calm and less stressed.
pros: Features all natural herbs to ease anxiety and stress without drowsiness
Also helps calm stomachs for car rides
Most cats only need one capsule, which takes effect in 20 to 40 minutes and lasts for 4 to 6 hours
Can be used for cats and dogs
cons: Capsules can be tricky to administer to some cats

customer_reviews.title: She didn't get sick!
customer_reviews.text: Our 9 month old puppy has gotten sick anytime she is in the car longer than 10 minutes. We took her with us camping up in the mountains, and she didn't get sick! I gave her a pill right before we left, then one an hour later, and one another hour and a half later. She was calm, comfy, and sweet as we traveled. She even went 4 wheeling on a mountain road without getting sick. So very grateful we were able to find this.
customer_reviews.author: momof3

customer_reviews.title: capsules are huge- too big for small dogs
customer_reviews.text: Only 3 stars because my pup is 10lbs and the capsules were way to big. She ingested 1 and it didn't do much for her, but then again she is a hyper dog...(benadryl works much better for her..) I gave the pills to my coworker who just adopted a medium sized dog who had separation anxiety. She said that they worked for about 90 minutes and then her dog was back up / barking / wondering around the apartment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Miracle in a bottle.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 9 year old poodle who is terrified of fireworks. She shakes so much that her teeth rattled. A vet prescribed some type of tranquilizer that semi-immobilized her, but she was still aware and frightened (I changed vets). This product was recommended to me by a friend and it has been a life changer for us! These pills calm her and let her still move around if she wants to. She still doesn't like the fireworks, but she doesn't shake or do the panic panting. I am amazed at how well they work, and there are no lingering after affects. this product also comes in dog treats, which she loves.
customer_reviews.author: GaleM

customer_reviews.title: Works Fast, No Side Effects
customer_reviews.text: My dog has episodes during the night that may be early onset senility or some kind of seizure. He wanders as if he cannot see, his coordination is affected, and he becomes agitated. This can go on for hours. As soon as it starts I give him one Happy Traveler and within 20 to 30 minutes he falls asleep. I've tried melatonin but it leaves him groggy. Happy Traveler does not. I'm sold on this organic calming supplement. It's really helped my dog live a better life.
customer_reviews.author: Adrasteia

customer_reviews.title: Kinda works...
customer_reviews.text: We bought the pills to try and calm down our excitable Chihuahua/Dachshund mix. He treats a new person in the house to continuous barking. With the pill, he stopped after an hour. No sure if it was the "Happy" pill or just fatigue. We'll try once more by giving him a pill an hour before a new visitor makes an entrance. I'll provide an evaluation after our second try. Or not.
customer_reviews.author: Leeward

customer_reviews.title: Huge capsule
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping this would work for our puppy, who is terrified riding in the car and gets car sick. The capsule is so large, we had to break it open and sprinkle it on some peanut butter. Unfortunately within a half hour from leaving our home, she threw it all up. I'm glad it works for some people, but it didn't for us.
customer_reviews.author: Janelle

customer_reviews.title: Calms down my dog
customer_reviews.text: I think for an herbal medication this works the best on my dog. It does not knock him unconscious but slows down his fright and frenzy to a tolerable amount and eventually he goes to sleep. Fireworks, loud explosions, gunshots fry his nerves badly (and mine, too). I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Olive

customer_reviews.title: Too big
customer_reviews.text: We can’t get it down our pup’s throat! She’s a 5 month Norwich Terrier weighs almost 10 lbs. She gets upset just trying to get 1 down. Can’t return so a waste of money for us.
customer_reviews.author: CrisJoy

customer_reviews.title: Better than nothing. Smells like concentrated stinky feet.
customer_reviews.text: Be prepared to come up with your own method for administering this to a cat. The gelcaps are much too large to stuff down a cat's throat. I dosed this noxious smelling herb combo dissolved in water with a medicine dropper. My tough, active tabby hated it of course. Two dosed did not stop him from periodically howling and spazzing out inside his carrier during a 3 hour flight. Maybe it took the edge off, but it's dubious.
customer_reviews.author: M. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for my dog.
customer_reviews.text: I have a very active Jack Russell terrier. I bought this because she is very anxious in the car. She whines the entire time and is all over the place if she is not held. I tried these pill and it did not seem to have any effect on her at all. I am not saying it won't work for your dog, it just didn't for mine.
customer_reviews.author: anitasegobia

customer_reviews.title: Relaxation for your dog while traveling
customer_reviews.text: I gave these to my dog on a trip and they were wonderful because they are natural. It helped relax her for a trip across country. I would recommend if you are traveling with your dog or if they are out in stressful situations. My dog was not not drugged up like meds but relaxed.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth J. Schofield

customer_reviews.title: Great for nausea!
customer_reviews.text: My dog used to throw up about every 10 minutes in the car, but hasn't once since I started giving him Happy Travelers 30 minutes before getting in the car! It's also good to help keep him calmer when he has to be home alone.
customer_reviews.author: Elisa

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: My dogs hate traveling in the car. Gave them a dose before our camping trip and they tolerated the 2 hour ride with no crying or shaking. Just layer in the back all mellow and watching the scenery. This is now one of my must haves for trips with the pooches!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Doran

customer_reviews.title: Worked on my pup!
customer_reviews.text: My dog HATES car rides and also gets car sick. He freaks out if its even down the street. I usually assume "natural" products are less effective than chemical ones, but I took a risk and tried these. Surprisingly and thankfully, they worked!! 8 hours in the car and he was calm and didn't get sick. That made both of us happy travelers :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Large Capsules
customer_reviews.text: Note that these are a large capsule like what a human would take. My dog will typically take pills with no problem but she refuses to take these despite trying to hide them with food, peanut butter, etc. I eventually cut open the capsule and attempted to mix the ingredients with the peanut butter but my dog refused to eat it. So I cannot speak to the actual effects of the medication because my dog refused to take it.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Knack

customer_reviews.title: This product worked very well
customer_reviews.text: I followed the directions, so according to her weight, I gave my dog 2 capsules 40 minutes before leaving, and it worked great. But then she had a hard time walking into the house when we returned home. Now I only give her one capsule, and she does fine. She LOVES to go for a ride, but she pants and drools, so these capsules allow her to calm down and enjoy herself. No more having to clean up when returning home! These really do work!
customer_reviews.author: P.A. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Helps with travel anxiety!
customer_reviews.text: This product really helps my dog's calm down for a trip. Their anxiety is reduced and they just relax during a long drive!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works on some things but not all things
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this on both my cats. Once when we were moving and it seemed to help a little. The ones anxiety was so bad she still urinated In the carrier. Lately, I’ve been using it on a cat going through an eye sight transition and it’s been relaxing her to the point where she finally slept peacefully. So, there are good things and bad.
customer_reviews.author: Adele Steiger

customer_reviews.title: Calming and Gentle
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Happy Traveler with my Border Collie for the past 4 years. She hates fireworks and thunder. This product is good for taking the edge off a scary situation. Without it, Jenny pants, shakes and cannot relax. I give her 1 capsule as the storms start to roll in and it calms her to the point that she can lay down next to me with no shivering. She readily takes the capsule with a bit of peanut butter on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amc

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful
customer_reviews.text: This stuff has helped our Airedale immensely. We use it every year around Independence Day because the sound of fireworks and gun shots keep him on edge. He also gets uneasy during thunderstorms so we have used it then as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not sure that these did any good at all with my dog
customer_reviews.text: Not sure that these did any good at all with my dog. I ended up giving her bonine, and that helped more, but mainly worked on getting her in and out of the car (with treats inside), then very short trips (with treats), followed by longer trips. It seemed to help her to have the windows open. After 2 months, she's now fine riding in the car--even on long trips.
customer_reviews.author: Chief Cynic In Charge

customer_reviews.title: Dogs will not take the medication
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, my pups will not take the capsule without being made to do so. I have used peanut butter on the capsule and cheese. I even tried opening the capsule to mix with food and they wouldn’t accept it either. Very disappointing. The medication is not returnable. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best stuff for calming my shepherd during thunderstorms
customer_reviews.text: Best stuff for calming my shepherd during thunderstorms. It takes the edge off and keeps him calmer. Been using it for years.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought Happy Travelers to help manage my older dog’s anxiety. What I didn’t know was that his anxiety was a symptom of canine dementia. The Happy Travelers are managing his symptoms and I am very grateful for this Happy accident.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Margaret Collins

customer_reviews.title: Carsick Dog
customer_reviews.text: Capsules are big so it was hard to get down my Shih-tzu but he didn't get carsick.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Wallace

customer_reviews.title: These are life savers! And trip savers!
customer_reviews.text: These saved our trip! We didn't realize our dog would get so car sick. We had never taken him on a long trip before. When we reached Moscow, ID, we ordered some of these. We got them before we left to come home. Our trip home was so much better than the trip up there.
customer_reviews.author: Angel 1727

customer_reviews.title: Different things work for different dogs and but I have found this work great for most dogs I have given it too
customer_reviews.text: Helps take the edge off! Different things work for different dogs and but I have found this work great for most dogs I have given it too. Really does help take the edge off. Give about 30 minutes prior to stressful event and good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Dog Lover

customer_reviews.title: I have used Happy Traveler for years
customer_reviews.text: I have used Happy Traveler for years. It is a great herbal calmer for our fur babies. It's not a drug, so you should still go to your Vet for more heavy duty needs, but for storms or traveling this is great.
customer_reviews.author: Gwynavere

customer_reviews.title: Diarrhea for two days...
customer_reviews.text: My dog wouldn't take these pills (chews his treats thoroughly) so I opened 2 capsules and emptied them into his water. He drank it all had uncontrollable diarrhea for the next two days. It got him to the dog park with less anxiety to and from but I was cleaning diarrhea for two days after. Not worth it. I don't think it's because I had to open the capsule (no difference in absorption in the stomach). My dog just didn't tolerate it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Good for keeping calm, not quite car sickness
customer_reviews.text: This helps my dog somewhat. I would keep looking for another solution.
customer_reviews.author: Irish

customer_reviews.title: Works for motion sickness
customer_reviews.text: My 50lbs pittie gets super car sick and these have worked like a charm. He does get a bit sleepy after a few hours but it's usually just lets him sleep on the way home.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Bermudez

customer_reviews.title: Helps calm my dog on long trips
customer_reviews.text: My dog hates travelling and these do help her relax without the use of a prescription drug.
customer_reviews.author: marita e

customer_reviews.title: More is better.
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to not help much. Maybe I should have given him, at 90 lbs. More than two.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: ARK NATURALS Happy Traveler - Capsule
customer_reviews.text: My dog trembles terribly when there are any storms coming. These have helped her immensely.
customer_reviews.author: MsAfak

customer_reviews.title: Did nothing
customer_reviews.text: This didn’t have any effect on my pup. Also, capsules don’t seem great for dog consumption since they chew everything.
customer_reviews.author: nat statsky

customer_reviews.title: I was hesitant to give her something the vet prescribed so I was happy when I found a natural product
customer_reviews.text: My dog has always suffered from anxiety and these seem to really help her. I was hesitant to give her something the vet prescribed so I was happy when I found a natural product. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Wagner

customer_reviews.title: these little capsules are AWESOME..
customer_reviews.text: these little capsules are AWESOME...for one of my 4 dogs...the other 3, keep eating the capsule pocket and spill the capsule out while maintaining eye contact with me!! like telling me: mom...you just can't fool us..😖😖😖
customer_reviews.author: Adri Fonta

customer_reviews.title: This works
customer_reviews.text: Kept my dogs calm and relaxed. Simply sprinkled it on dry food and added a little water.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne f

customer_reviews.title: I travel with my miniature Yorkies a lot and figured ...
customer_reviews.text: I travel with my miniature Yorkies a lot and figured I'd give this a try. I did nothing for my pups. There was no change in the anxiety they get when flying.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Helps
customer_reviews.text: My pup gets car sick and this seems to help
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: Called him down a lot. Our dog has separation ...
customer_reviews.text: Called him down a lot. Our dog has separation anxiety, we give him one before work. When I get home at lunch he is just chilling. I would say they work well.
customer_reviews.author: Ak47

customer_reviews.title: This really works!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! I moved 4 hrs away and my cat Topaz, gets motion sickness and howls. I mixed one Happy Traveler capsule into some wet food and Topaz was calm for the entire trip! Best investment for Me and my cat!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for dogs when you need to settle them down
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful for dogs when you need to settle them down. Works well when under the weather. Or need to keep them quiet.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lueck

customer_reviews.title: Carsick Puppy
customer_reviews.text: Our year old golden retriever has always gotten car sick. With these capsules she relaxes and stays calm in the car. No more vomiting! I'm as happy for her as I am for me with no messes to clean up as we travel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These have helped calmed down my pit bull when we ...
customer_reviews.text: These have helped calmed down my pit bull when we travel back and forth between Atlanta and New York. We immediately noticed a difference. The pills aren't magic by any means. But our pit was calmer, and only displayed a limited amount of anxiety.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: drowsy
customer_reviews.text: Don't get for separation anxiety, it won't stop barky behavior.
customer_reviews.author: accountholder

customer_reviews.title: It did nothing to my fat cat
customer_reviews.text: It did not help to calm my Fat cat when we went to the airport... They also ask us to rate the flavor?!!???? lol IDK the pill were for humans? or my fat cat? Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nimbus Miami Corp

customer_reviews.title: Although the ingredients were good my dog refused to take it and when I ...
customer_reviews.text: Although the ingredients were good my dog refused to take it and when I put in down his throat before traveling it came back up 2 1/2 hours in our car trip. My daughter had better results with keeping here calm during thunderstorms.
customer_reviews.author: jcmiltz

customer_reviews.title: Capsules are big and didnt work.
customer_reviews.text: The capsules are really big and they didn't work. Worth a shot for the price but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria D

customer_reviews.title: I haven't seen any change in my dogs demeanor. ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't seen any change in my dogs demeanor. I used these as I was traveling via air, and my dog did calm down a little, but I don't know if it was the pills or her being scared. I've used them since but still don't see a change.
customer_reviews.author: Britney M. Co

customer_reviews.title: Open bottle with only 3 pills
customer_reviews.text: Received bottle when I went to open it, it was already opened and only 3 pills were in the bottle. This is the only time this has ever happened. I can’t return as I need this today. I am totally wanting to be reimbursed
customer_reviews.author: L. Secunda

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t do a damn thing. If I could get my money back I would.
customer_reviews.author: imanny23

customer_reviews.title: Sorry this product did not work for either one of ...
customer_reviews.text: Sorry this product did not work for either one of our dogs. It actually seemed to make them more anxious than relaxed.
customer_reviews.author: Alice R.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work. I have my 6 month old pup a pill 1 hr before we left and 1 pill when getting ready to leave and he still there up 5 mins after we left
customer_reviews.author: Ashley D.

customer_reviews.title: Dog Gone It
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea if this works. I just absolutely could not fool my dog into ingesting it. The product may be great, but ...
customer_reviews.author: W. Lae

customer_reviews.title: So far...so good.
customer_reviews.text: It did what we wanted it to do. No car sick pup for a 3 1/2 hour drive and also another dose back.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Spanjar

customer_reviews.title: Eh....This Is Supposed to Help?
customer_reviews.text: This product had minimal effect on my small dog during a thunderstorm. He still shook and panted and drooled. Perhaps not as much as usual? I'm counting on prayer and happy thoughts to get him through the next one. Probably won't be buying this again. Too bad.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rooth

customer_reviews.title: Not happy. My dog still threw up all over me
customer_reviews.text: Not happy. My dog still threw up all over me.
customer_reviews.author: Fay

customer_reviews.title: Un-Happy travler here
customer_reviews.text: These pills didn't do anything for my hyper dog. She did eat up the pill so it must taste good however she never relaxed & got calm.
customer_reviews.author: Suzette C.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: very pleased with purchased. Used to help prepare my dog for air travel. His trip went very well.
customer_reviews.author: Dawne Pilgrim

customer_reviews.title: Great product for temporary anxiety relief
customer_reviews.text: This product worked great on my 3 small dogs while doing a long distance drive. I would recommend however that you give supplement capsule 45-60 minutes before travel.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mchugh

customer_reviews.title: Separation Anxiety
customer_reviews.text: We have a 60 pound lab/collie mix that has HORRIBLE separation anxiety. We thought we'd try this out, it had no effect on her at all. The only thing we have found that works for her is a thunder shirt.
customer_reviews.author: tech360

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for relief for my dog, but no change in her road trip symptoms unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Gemella

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I mainly use this during the fourth of July as my pet is scared of the fireworks. Works like a charm. He is super calm during the event
customer_reviews.author: Eric Thompson

customer_reviews.title: happy
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product for a couple of years. It does not sedate your pet. I use it for a little (mild) anxiety when traveling and it seems to help. I can tell a difference when I use it and don't use. It seems to help him be more calm without sedating him. I like it, I have noticed some others do not think it works. My pet is only 23 lbs and I use 1 and in 30 min give another and wait 1 hr before we start our trip and it seems to help.
customer_reviews.author: pmsdea

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't do much of anything for our 65 lb dog ...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't do much of anything for our 65 lb dog. Even gave him a pill more then said on package.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Calms our anxious dog
customer_reviews.text: We tried happy traveler before deciding to ultimately put our dog on prescription medication (Prozac) but still use the happy traveler from time to time. Happy Traveler absolutely makes your dog nice and sleepy. Its perfect for a long car ride and I would recommend it to someone before they put their dog on a prescription because it may work for them.
customer_reviews.author: Siobhan Koch

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work at all. I gave it to my ...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work at all. I gave it to my puppy and she still throw up and supper hyper. She didn't show any sign of relaxing or calm.
customer_reviews.author: Nha Hoan Le

customer_reviews.title: Work great !
customer_reviews.text: These are great! I also tried the chewable of the same brand, which my dogs wouldn't touch, even wrapped in peanut butter. Thought I'd try these capsules. So glad I did! They are odorless & I'm assuming tasteless because both dogs will take them with a little peanut butter or wrapped in cheese with no coaxing. They calm my bulldog mixes quite well. Our rescue had a traumatizing past, noises terrify him, kitchen utensils, candles, storms..if I gv him a few of these, the frantic pacing & panting stops & he calms down within 30 min & remains calm for a few hours which helps immensely! So happy we found something to help our puppy loves!
customer_reviews.author: Candygrl5

customer_reviews.title: Happy Traveler
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product with all natural ingredients. Does not contain alcohol like some of the calming drops do. Works well for calming my dog for Fourth of July or groomer.
customer_reviews.author: BJ Williams

customer_reviews.title: No luck for us :(
customer_reviews.text: My GSD had no problem taking the capsules, but they did nothing for her, no matter the dose. I would not buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Get this for my guys when having company or taking them to the vets. Haven't noticed a big difference in their demeanor.
customer_reviews.author: Rory Bill

customer_reviews.title: Didn't do a thing!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this product because our dog is very difficult when it comes to trimming his paws. We gave him the recommeded dose and waited... and waited... and waited. It didn't work on him at all. Although the pills are inexpensive, they don't work so don't waste your money...
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Hope these work as well as the soft chews. ...
customer_reviews.text: Hope these work as well as the soft chews. Have not tried them yet on my dog, but will be soon.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Anaya

customer_reviews.title: I don't want to blame the pills... ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't want to blame the pills...maybe it's just that it didn't work for my dog. He gets car sick on long trips...I can't seem to find the right thing to help him
customer_reviews.author: Mary T Sharpe

customer_reviews.title: It’s works
customer_reviews.text: My dog seems really relax after I give her the product
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: More of the same
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many different products for my dog to calm her anxiety. The product is fine, but no better or worse than any other natural product.
customer_reviews.author: F. L. Sbar

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I think it helps with the thunderphobic dog. He seems to settle down.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila McHugh

customer_reviews.title: Have found peace!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to mix with food. Be sure to do this in a safe way as this powder will choke your pet if it is not mixed with something wet like their food. At times of stress, this works very well for my cats and dogs. Dogs are easy to feed this to as I just place the pill in some cheese. My cats don't like the taste or smell of them. When I mix it with a food they like, it helps them with 4th of July nervousness A GREAT DEAL! With thus supplement, my house is peaceful during loud/ stressful times!!!
customer_reviews.author: Emee Luis

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: It just doesn't work. Beagle (8 month, 28lb) two capsules - no result.
customer_reviews.author: Sveet

customer_reviews.title: Product works for us.
customer_reviews.text: Works for our dog on long trips. We like that it is herbs. He is somewhat subdued for about 12 hrs.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: I had to take my cat on wonderful Southwestern Airlines
customer_reviews.text: Would buy again if I had to travel with a pet. I had to take my cat on wonderful Southwestern Airlines....the ones that allow you to bring your small pets. I had my sweet little kitty in a stroller. I had to roll him all around the airport if you can imagine that. He looked stunned but was very patient and calm. He had never left his house...now he is a world traveler, and if you know cats....you know that he knows it! :)
customer_reviews.author: Luv Working Out

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does nothing for my dog! Plus it took 2 weeks to get here!
customer_reviews.author: joy

customer_reviews.title: This really works.
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this product for several years. One of my dogs takes it for storm phobia, and another takes it for storm phobia and separation anxiety.
customer_reviews.author: Geralyn Husketh

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Quick delivery and the product seems to work during storms.
customer_reviews.author: Louise Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: It's been a great product for 2 of my dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Happy Traveller pills for years. My beloved Brittany Spaniel Ginger was terrified of Thunderstorms, and I found that the Happy Traveller helped her a lot. Sometimes I would need a Thundershirt and play "Music to Calm Your Dog". It made a huge difference. I thought it was over when Ginger went to the Rainbow Bridge. However, my new Bitt has admitted he has thunder phobia -- and a Happy Traveller an hour before expected storm takes a huge edge off of his fear.
customer_reviews.author: Mirabelle

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Works for my dog .... She is 5 years old and gets very car sick
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for years. My Shepherd got carsick. This eliminates that. It also works well for severe thunderstorms.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqualin

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for us
customer_reviews.text: My dogs got one of these, another over the counter calmer and 1mg of vet prescribed valium for a plane trip and all that together didn't even phase them. My poor chihuahuas freaked out at the airport and we didn't even make it on the plane. Obviously my dogs need a strong tranquilizer for the next trip. These were recommend from a friend who used them on her dogs when she traveled and said they worker great. Maybe for some people, just not for us.
customer_reviews.author: Lmk

customer_reviews.title: My dog threw up a few hours after giving this ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog threw up a few hours after giving this to him. Won't use again. Also not sure how you get a dog to swallow a decent size capsule.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Frank

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are great, helped my girl calm during thunderstorms, wind storms, and trips to the vet.
customer_reviews.author: kathleen williamd

customer_reviews.title: Good rest for the animal and good rest for us ...
customer_reviews.text: It works wonders to help old tiered dogs get some rest. 15 year old dog that will pant for hours. Good rest for the animal and good rest for us bipedal animals too.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L VandenBrink

customer_reviews.title: Not so good
customer_reviews.text: Sorry hasn't helped my 2 year old German Shepherd at all.
customer_reviews.author: F. Beard

customer_reviews.title: This product not only works great for car trips
customer_reviews.text: At last...some help with our lovely Lucy's stress levels! This product not only works great for car trips, but I've used it to tame canine aggression, too. Out of the blue, our 5-year-old pup began lunging and snarling at dogs in the park on her daily walk. Upsetting for everyone. Vet said she was acting out in fear and stress. We tried goodie training, calm talk, tough love...EVERYTHING. Happy Traveler is the only thing that has worked. Whew. Walk time is now happy time for all of us!
customer_reviews.author: M. B HOGAN

customer_reviews.title: This product does what it says it will
customer_reviews.text: I think this product helps to calm my cats when they get nervous.
customer_reviews.author: Signe Woodin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: Received item the day after I was notified it had shipped!! Awesome!!! Thank you!

customer_reviews.title: they seemed pretty much calmed
customer_reviews.text: It really helps My two cats took 11 hr flight and I fed them just before getting on a plane. they seemed pretty much calmed.

customer_reviews.text: well tried it on the cockapoo and so far it hasn't worked - i'm holding out hope though that the next time we use it it will,.

customer_reviews.title: Results are not consistent. Sometimes he doesn't get sick ...
customer_reviews.text: Results are not consistent. Sometimes he doesn't get sick and sometimes he still does.
customer_reviews.author: Indy Reader

customer_reviews.title: only in larger than recommended doses, though
customer_reviews.text: We have an aggressive and fairly deranged male pug. I believe it helped calm him down, only in larger than recommended doses, though. It did not make him loopy.
customer_reviews.author: KEVIN cOWGILL

product_meta.title: Ark Lighting Happy Traveler 30 Capsule
product_meta.description:
Ark Naturals Happy Traveler is a safe all natural herbal calming formula for stressed, nervous, or anxious pets. 

Eases separation and travel anxiety, motion sickness, and tension caused by changes in your pet's daily routine. Happy Traveler was designed by a nutrition and herbal scientistist using premium, human-grade natural materials. Non habit-forming, no harmful side effects when used as directed. 

Product Facts: For Dogs & Cats 12 weels and older.
Recommended for:
Motion sickness.
Visible nervous behavior.
Per separation anxiety.
Persistent "crying".
Fear of unfamiliar people and other pets.
Inappropriate aggressive behavior.
Visits to kennels, groomers and vets.
Fear of thunderstorms & Fireworks
Pets stressed when their daily routine is changed
